page.title: 01Parish of Boarstall, Bucks
page.content: Consists of a rural area, church, remains of a fortified manor house, scattered houses, several outlying farms with a hamlet - Honeyburge. Some 48 rented & owned dwellings with 98 inhabitants, & 30 children either working on the land, retired, or commuting to surrounding areas for work or schooling. Muswell Hill to the NE, with cultivated & grassfields, rises 300ft above Danes Brook's shallow valley with the village surrounded by mainly pasture & the Hamlet with cultivated fields. To the West Panshill Ridge, running northerly, drops down with cultivated fields towards the River Ray. The land of clay, loam & small stones is 60% cultivated with corn oilseed rape & miscellaneous animal food crops. Remainder being grassland for beef & milk production, cont./...
